title: Programming courses - Java, C, OCaml, HTML, JS, Node, NoSQL
description: Learn about Java, C, OCaml, Web-related languages (HTML, CSS, JS, PHP, Node) and databases-related languages (SQL, NoSQL). We also have courses about Assembly, TypeScript, Cybersecurity, and API.

e1.name: OCaml
e1.desc: OCaml may be used when you need to write a safe program (as it is a functional language). It's quite easy to learn, almost no syntax.

e2.name: SQL
e2.desc: Relational databases are using SQL (89 or 92) as their query language. Since ~2011, NoSQL databases are more and more used.

e2.name: PL/SQL
e2.desc: If you want to add functions in SQL, you need to learn the Procedural Language (PL) for SQL. In PostgreSQL, this is called PL/pgSQL.

e2.name: NoSQL
e2.desc: Learn about NoSQL 'NotOnlySQL', 4 new kinds of databases which are more flexible than relational databases (such as MongoDB or Cypher).

e3.name: WEB
e3.desc: How to start, what you need to know, ... and everything that couldn't be put in a specific language course.

e3.name: HTML
e3.desc: A complete summary of what you need to know in HTML to make a website.

e3.name: CSS
e3.desc: What's CSS and how you could use it to make your website looks better.

e3.name: JavaScript
e3.desc: A short introduction to JavaScript used to make interactive websites or required for Node.js/Typescript courses.

e4.name: Cryptography
e4.desc: An introduction to cryptography (Modular arithmetic, encryption, and decryption of messages, RSA)
